title: Top schools are designing admissions policies that favour middle class families, Good Schools Guide says
text:
Confusing school admission policies are running to 12 pages, the Good Schools Guide says as it accuses institutions of pandering to the middle classes.

Some of the most sought after state schools issue complicated and convoluted information about their entry criteria, which is difficult to navigate and “no doubt favours certain sections of society”, it has been claimed.

Elizabeth Coatman, the Good Schools Guide’s state education specialist, said: “The variation in admissions policies is incredible. What one school demands of an applicant may be very different from the requirements of an apparently similar school down the road.
